column1: What is AWS X-Ray primarily used for?
column2: Distributed tracing of applications to understand performance bottlenecks and get insights into the behavior of the applications.

column1: What feature of AWS X-Ray allows you to visualize latency bottlenecks and identify problematic services?
What does AWS X-Ray's 'Insights' feature provide?
column2: It offers anomaly detection to inform you of potential issues impacting your users.

column1: How can developers integrate their applications with AWS X-Ray?
column2: Through the AWS X-Ray SDK, which provides hooks into various AWS services and can trace HTTP requests.

column1: Why would one use the flexible sampling rules in AWS X-Ray?
column2: To configure and determine how much data they want to record for their traces.
